com.magnet.connection

Interface HttpClientConfigBean

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.magnet.config.api.EnableableConfiguration
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ConnectionServiceConfigBean

    public interface HttpClientConfigBean
extends com.magnet.config.api.EnableableConfiguration
    HttpClient related configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • getProtocol

        @Description(value="The protocol (e.g., http or https)")
@DefaultValue(value="http")
String getProtocol()
        The protocol (e.g., http or https).

      • getPort

        @DefaultValue(value="8080")
Integer getPort()
        The port.

      • getConnectionTimeoutInSecs

        @Description(value="The timeout for wating for a connection")
@DefaultValue(value="30")
Integer getConnectionTimeoutInSecs()
        The timeout value in seconds.

      • getMaxConnections

        @Description(value="The maximum number of connections to allow at once")
@DefaultValue(value="20")
Integer getMaxConnections()
        The max number of connections allowed.

      • getUsername

        @Description(value="The username associated with the connection")
@Optional
String getUsername()
        The username associated with the connection.

      • getCredential

        @Description(value="The credential associated with the connection")
@Optional
@SecuritySensitive
String getCredential()
        The credential associated with the connection.

      • getCredentialType

        @DefaultValue(value="cleartext")
String getCredentialType()
        The mechanism user for authentication.

      • getAuthority

        @Optional
String getAuthority()
        The authority name.

      • getSslType

        @Optional
@Description(value="SSL connection type : anonymous, one_way, two_way, trust_all_certs.")
String getSslType()
        SSL connection type : anonymous, one_way, two_way.

      • getHostNameVerifier

        @Optional
String getHostNameVerifier()
        This is only required when the connection is secure (i.e. https) Valid values are ALLOW_ALL_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER, STRICT_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER, BROWSER_COMPATIBLE_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER By default we use BROWSER_COMPATIBLE_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER

      • getKeyStorePath

        @Optional
@Description(value="The fully qualified path to the keystore file")
String getKeyStorePath()
        This is only required when 2-way ssl(i.e. mutual authentication) is required.

      • getKeyStorePassword

        @SecuritySensitive
@Description(value="The password to open the keystore file")
@Optional
String getKeyStorePassword()

      • getKeyAlias

        @Description(value="The alias to find the key within the keystore")
@Optional
String getKeyAlias()

      • getKeyPassword

        @SecuritySensitive
@Description(value="The password to the key corresponding to the alias")
@Optional
String getKeyPassword()

      • getTrustStorePath

        @Optional
@Description(value="The fully qualified path to the trust store file")
String getTrustStorePath()
        This is only required when a non default trust store is to be used in one way Authentication (i.e. Server's certificate is checked).

      • getTrustStorePassword

        @Optional
@Description(value="The password to the trust store file")
@SecuritySensitive
String getTrustStorePassword()
        This is only required when a non default trust store is used.
